sentence.text: Biallelic ion transmembrane transport mutations cause infantile hypotonia with psychomotor retardation and characteristic facies 2 (IHPRF2), which is characterized by hypotonia, developmental delay (DD)/intellectual disability (ID), intrauterine growth retardation, postnatal growth retardation and characteristic facial features.
Common facial dysmorphisms include a thin upper nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay, a tented upper lip, a triangular face, strabismus and microcephaly.

entity.text: nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay
